reviews.text: The staff who greeted us were very helpful and animated. They walked us through the process of choosing your favorite team (which is an awesome feature that lets you customize your experience somewhat). The interactive exhibits made the Hall of Fame much more interesting than I, as not a huge fan of college football, expected. It was a fun couple hours!

I only planned to spend a couple hours here but my three boys 6, 8, and 11 had such a good time we spent over 5 hrs here!  Very interactive and fun.  The best thing about the place was the employees. They really we're helpful and cheered my kids on as they did the athletic activities as well as interactive exhibits. I can't say enough about the people working here, AWESOME!

The place itself was lovely but there was one lady at the entrance that wasn't friendly. I know they deal with alot of people everyday but you still need to be nice and not be like "Get out the way take pictures later", etc. She should be a traffic guard.... But other than her the staff was great.

Being a fan of college football this place was Heaven. All the interactive activities were a lot of fun. When you go in, you sign up with your email address and the number on your lanyard they give you, you tell them your favorite team. It uses RFID technology so everytime you go buy a display that is Interactive it automatically recognizes you and your favorite team and brings up information on it. For example, the virtual face painting, it automatically brought up the right colors and logos for my school. You may also choose another school as well but it automatically brings up the one you registered with. There is also and indoor 40-yard football field where anyone can kick field goals or throw passes along with a huge big screen you can sit in bleachers and watch college football in on game day.

If you're a fan of college football, you'll love it. Pretty interactive. I wish they had more details about the dynasties and coaches, but there is still a lot here. They have a room with video boards where you can look up by about anything you want. Make the stop, you won't regret it.

Delicious food and excellent service! Tonight was our first experience eating Indian cuisine. Our waiter was knowledgeable and friendly with his recommendations and my husband and I both truly enjoyed our experiences.  We would recommend this restaurant to friends and family, and we will definitely be coming back ourselves.
This place was great. We ordered Lamb chops and chicken masala? (The first menu in curry categories) and they were nice. We will visit there again definitely.
The food is amazing and the wait staff so friendly. Every time we are in Ann Arbor we eat there as no other Indian restaurant is as good. We've been eating there for 20 years.

One of the best Indian restaurants I've eaten at and I have been eating there for years. Reminds me of the nicer Indian restaurants in Great Brittan where I first tried Indian food. Authentic food served in a very nice atmosphere. The waiters are all very professional and efficient. I asked about a dish I used to order but was not on the menu now and the waiter said they would make it for me... Chicken Hyderabadi (not sure I spelled that right) delicious! I'll back when I'm in town again.

The food is delicious in every word possible! I went with my mom, and she's usually picky when it comes to food, but she absolutely loved their food. Our waiter was the best! The prices are not that bad. The service was good, a man in a suit (I believe the owner) came to our to check up on us. All in all, it was a great first experience.

I have been eating here since I was a kid (I'm 35). The deep-fried spring rolls are to die for. The owner and family are wonderful. Don't be fooled by the simple decor - the food is wonderful and from a first-generation Vietnamese Canadian who knows good food with classic techniques. Thanks for 25 years of fantastic dining!!!
The food: Fantastic. The service: Speedy and friendly. The portions: Huge. The price: Great. The wonderful free tea: The finishing touch to a perfect meal. Eat here. Full stop.
Food was great and cheap! They serve some nice tea as well with your meal. The staff was really friendly 😊!
I love his place! The food is always hot and fresh, the service friendly and the prices are more than reasonable. Would highly recommend!

Good service but very dirty restaurant and the most bland and basic pad Thai I've ever eaten, and I've eaten a lot of pad Thai!! I'd suggest eating elsewhere for both a cleaner environment and more flavour. There are lots of good Thai and Vietnamese restaurants in London. Thaifoon and Tamarine on Dundas are both amazing. Thai Cuisine on Gainsborough too.
